summary:
Android is an operating system for mobile devices like smartphones and tablets. It's based on Linux and open-source software. Google and a group of developers created it in 2007. Most Android devices use Google's version, which comes with its apps and services.

The open-source version, AOSP, is free, but Google owns the Android brand. Many companies use Android, often with their own custom features. It's very popular, with over three billion active users. The latest version, Android 15, works on various devices, from phones to Chromebooks.
title: Android (operating system)
